text: HRay <rl4  rrTArif wifearu TMNT Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (Tev Tar7 3 trurf 4A1+7T) WT Fax : 91-11-25093507 25093544 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) vi-5 V 6, 74zr-10 , ETraT, 7 farit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/218/2007-Admn Dated: 24.07.2014 Policy_Matters: Technical (161/2014) (Decision taken on File No NHATICMCPPolicy Isgues/2014/1) Sub: Structuring/Re-structuring of projects It has been decided to prepare a shelf of projects in respect of all the balance projects of NHDP which have not been awarded. This would also include projects which have  been   included in the Annual Plan for the current,  preceding and subsequent financial years, projects which have been terminated foreclosed and projects for which no bids were received. Based on the cost of the project and traffic volume; the project may or may not he viable on toll. Adopting waterfall mechanism of first bidding o toll and then in case of no response, reverting to other modes of implementation causes unnecessary delay in award of works It is, therefore, requested that the projects may he structured restructured as per the following procedure: The projects proposals may be formulated straightaway on EPC mode for all projects which are prima-facie not viable on BOT (Toll) . Based On financial analysis, projects which require VGF' in excess of 20% of TPC would deemed to he unviable on BOT (Toll) mode. The projects proposals may be formulated on BOT(Toll) mode for all projects which, based on financial analysis, are prima-facie viable on BOT (Toll) with some estimated premium; iii) The projects proposals may he formulated hoth on BOT(Toll) a8 well as EPC mode for all projects which, hased on financial analysis, are prima-facic viable on BOT(Toll) with VGF requirement up to 20% of TPC. 2 For ensuring  wider participation by developers and keeping in view the present market   conditions, packaging of project   may be   suitably   structured to ensure that a8 far as possible TPC of a single EPC package should be around Rs.1,000 Crore. Similarly, & single BOT (Toll) package should normally be not more than 100-120 km. 3 It is requested that preparation of PPPACIEPC proposals as per above may he taken up on priority 80 that a shelf of projects is created which will facilitate speedy implementation of projects. 4 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority. 24 (V.KSharma) Chief General Manager (LA & Coord ) To: All officers and employees of HQROs/PIUs/CMUs/Site Offices 'fe7
